body_raw: Say $f_n,f:\mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ are uniformly continous functions a $f_n\to f$ pointwise. Is the convergence nessecarily uniform? I couldn't find an appropriate counter-example for this case so I tried proving it : We have $|f_n(x)-f_n(y)|<\epsilon/3$ for all $|x-y|<\delta_1$, also $|f(x)-f(y)|<\epsilon/3$ for $|x-y|<\delta_2$ and for all $n>N_x$ we have $|f_n(x)-f(x)|<\epsilon /3$.
